newsitem.title: USA: NY Gov. sees FY 1998 capital spending at $3.9 bln.
newsitem.headline: NY Gov. sees FY 1998 capital spending at $3.9 bln.

text.p: New York Gov. George Pataki on Tuesday disclosed his fiscal 1998 budget, estimating that captial spending would total $3.926 billion, a sum that would rise to $4.062 billion the next year.
The rise reflected a $661 million plan to build 7,000 new beds in three new prisons as well as expand additional prisons.

Further, the governor in his budget said he would seek to balance the state's debt profile by raising the use of short-term instruments by using more variable rate debt and interest rate exchange agreements.
Bond financing by public authorities was projected at 43 percent of capital spending in Pataki's five-year capital plan.
In fiscal 1998, the Administration said it expected bond issuance to total $2.556 billion, a level projected to rise to $2.955 billion in fiscal 1999, before declining to $2.657 billion by 2001-02.
